intro: Galium austriacum, commonly known as Austrian bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium austriacum is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in temperate regions of Europe.
